title: Incorrect generic parameter parsing when using const type_name.
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```rust
#![feature(const_type_name)]

use std::future::Future;

const fn do_something_depends_on_name<F: Future>() -> &'static str {
    std::any::type_name::<F>()
}

// error[E0401]: can't use generic parameters from outer function
const fn do_something_depends_on_name_1<F: Future>() -> &'static str {
    const type_name: &str = std::any::type_name::<F>();   
    type_name
}

fn main() {
    
}

```

I expected to see this happen: both functions should compile and pass.

Instead, this happened: function `do_something_depends_on_name_1` cannot be compiled, and the error message given by the compiler is: 

```
error[[E0401]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/error-index.html#E0401): can't use generic parameters from outer function
  --> src/main.rs:11:51
   |
10 | const fn do_something_depends_on_name_1<F: Future>() -> &'static str {
   |                                         - type parameter from outer function
11 |     const type_name: &str = std::any::type_name::<F>();   
   |                                                   ^ use of generic parameter from outer function
```

### Meta

Build using the Nightly version: 1.65.0-nightly (2022-09-15 cf9ed0dd5836201843d2). See: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=a79a161c558e64a472822605d824e138
